member.name: T:FXOpenExtendedApi.Net.TradeCommand
member.summary: Contains possible trade commands.

member.name: F:FXOpenExtendedApi.Net.TradeCommand.Market
member.summary: An order that an investor makes through a broker or brokerage service to buy or sell an investment immediately at the best available current price.

member.name: F:FXOpenExtendedApi.Net.TradeCommand.Limit
member.summary: An order placed with a brokerage to buy or sell a set number of shares at a specified price or better. Limit orders also allow an investor to limit the length of time an order can be outstanding before being canceled.

member.name: F:FXOpenExtendedApi.Net.TradeCommand.Stop
member.summary: A stop-limit order will be executed at a specified price (or better) after a given stop price has been reached. Once the stop price is reached, the stop-limit order becomes a limit order to buy (or sell) at the limit price or better.

members.member:
The method gets snapshot of trade transaction reports and subscribe to notifications. All reports will be received as events.
Time direction of reports snapshot> Specify false to receive only history snapshot; true to receive history snapshot and updates.
Optional parameter, which specifies the start date and time for trade transaction reports. You should specify the parameter, if you specified "to" parameter. The parameter is supported since 1.6 FIX version.
Optional parameter, which specifies the finish date and time for trade transaction reports. You should specify the parameter, if you specified "from" parameter. The parameter is supported since 1.6 FIX version.
Can not be null.

The method gets snapshot of trade transaction reports and subscribe to notifications. All reports will be received as events.
Time direction of reports snapshot> Specifye false to receive only history snapshot; true to receive history snapshot and updates.
Optional parameter, which specifies the start date and time for trade transaction reports. You should specify the parameter, if you specified "to" parameter. The parameter is supported since 1.6 FIX version.
Optional parameter, which specifies the finish date and time for trade transaction reports. You should specify the parameter, if you specified "from" parameter. The parameter is supported since 1.6 FIX version.
Specifies number of reports requested at once. Server has itself limitation and if you specify out of range value it will be ignored. Can not be null.

member.summary: Creates a new Bars stream instance. If startTime is less or equal than endTime then this is forward bars enumeration (from past to future), otherwise this is backward enumeration (from future to past). Anyway all bars should be in the following time range: Min(startTime, endTime) <= Bar.From and Bar.To <= Max(startTime, endTime)
member.param: Datafeed instance; can not be null.
A required symbol; can not be null.
A required price type: Bid or Ask.
Bar period instance; can not be null.
A start time of bars enumeration.
A end time of bars enumeration.
member.exception: If datafeed, period or symbol is null.
If preferredBufferSize is negative or zero.

If startTime is less or equal than endTime then this is forward bars enumeration (from past to future), otherwise this is backward enumeration (from future to past). member.param: Datafeed instance; can not be null.
A required symbol; can not be null.
A required price type: Bid or Ask.
Bar period instance; can not be null.
A start time of bars enumeration.
A end time of bars enumeration.
Bars enumeration requests bars from server by chunks. This is preferred chunk size. It should be positive.
